On july 24, 2011
norby89
what are tokens of appreciation and why do they give -10 wealth?
A Token of appreciation is a small gift you can give to a client, it automatically increases their satisfaction by 1.

You may also send a "Dogsbody" in the room of a guest to take care of them and when they're done you have a chance of increasing their satisfaction. Beware that's not always the case and this can also lead to decreasing satisfaction. You can decrease the chance of this happening by spending research points in the Lab on a tier 2 specialization called Doctor Feelgood.

Why are all clients a celebrity?
Good question, not to be mistaken with VIP guests.
On july 24, 2011
npfan
what are tokens of appreciation and why do they give -10 wealth?
You can lower the cost of sending a dogsbody into or lower the time a dogsbody spends in someone's room using lab points.

Another question is, do the welcome desk also resets, if i bequeath the motel?
On july 28, 2011
norby89
You can choose to bequeath your hotel to an employee so that they can run it and ake over its development. You will start again with a new establishment (at level 2), but you will retain the following possessions:

Your money,
1 employee,
All un-used objects (except decorative objects, whether installed or not).

That's all you're gonna be left with.

On august 1, 2011
[45106]
Bequeathing your hotel allows you to:
Earn a new star next to your hotel's name,
Earn + 150 ,
Increase the maximum number of research points which can be used in the Lab.

On august 7, 2011
npfan
Building those special rooms in the bottom floor won't interfere with the guests either.
On august 7, 2011
Erem
The top floor should be dedicated to the institute, laundromatrix, specialty room, etc. Why? Because then it doesn't interfere with the guests.
And then what happens when you want to expand your hotel upwards? Your top floor is no longer your top floor, and the Institute etc. separate the rooms in your new top floor from those in the floor below.
On august 7, 2011
Kompera
I have 2 rooms destroyed......how can i repair them?
Just as a clarification: If the room is occupied and also damaged (via random sink fire or fireworks display, for example) the only way to repair it is via a Repair Kit. Sending an employee to an occupied room always attempts to offer that guest a token of appreciation.
On august 7, 2011
norby89
Just as a clarification: If the room is occupied and also damaged (via random sink fire or fireworks display, for example) the only way to repair it is via a Repair Kit. Sending an employee to an occupied room always attempts to offer that guest a token of appreciation.
If you're out of repair kits, you can always move the guest to another room (unless it's the night of their departure) and then having an employee fix the room. It will give your guest -1 satisfaction point but depending on the state of the room that might be a lot better than -3 for example.
On august 7, 2011
Erem
If you're out of repair kits, you can always move the guest to another room (unless it's the night of their departure) and then having an employee fix the room. It will give your guest -1 satisfaction point...
-1 if you've invested a research point in Nomadic Pleasure. -2 otherwise, I believe.
On august 7, 2011
norby89

Dingeldong
On august 7, 2011
[68111]
Every week, Sunday night at midnight to be precise, you should pay the tax. There are two possible situations here:

* You have the money: the tax is automatically collected and you earn +1 level, with all the advantages this entails (fame, new rooms, new options...).
* You are potless: the tax is not collected, the Consortium officer will make fun of you and give you a lecture, but it ends there. Oh yeah, you won't level-up and you'll need to wait until the next payment is due.

Exactly nothing will happen.
On august 7, 2011

Kompera
Sorry for the double post, but I have a question about the Fireworks display.

Does it work immediately? Does it destroy the room immediately?
This might not be entirely accurate, I didn't pay strict attention when I used the fireworks display:

It does not destroy the room immediately. It goes off at midnight (maybe earlier), and causes -3 satisfaction worth of damage. I don't recall the amount of satisfaction boost it provides, but it's balanced somewhat by the damage. If you can repair the damage (Repair Kit, or move guest and use employees) then it's great.

I used mine with Pyros, since the room was going to be destroyed anyway.

Akkhima
Modob,
If a guest like (for example) heat, you can have someone who produces heat on all 4 sides, plus have a radiator in their room. All of those add +2 more satisfaction, so even if he slips in the shower, he can still be at 10

Maybe ive upgraded that room before quest ? and thats why it doesnt count?
First upgrade = Level 2 = 250
Since you upgraded a room before getting the quest, it doesn't count towards it.

On august 25, 2011
Kompera
Q8: Do different attributes like heat, smells, humidity, etc. only come from other guests or items that you put in the room? Like there are none of those attributes going on in a room with no one in it or next to it right?
A8: Correct. All emanations either come from guests in adjacent rooms or from the up to two items the player is allowed to place in each room.
Also note: The Isolation Chamber when added by the player as a room item prevents all emanations from either entering or exiting.
I have not tested the Isolation Chamber with a second item to see if the second item will impact the guest in that room. Can anyone comment on this?
On august 25, 2011
npfan
I have not tested the Isolation Chamber with a second item to see if the second item will impact the guest in that room. Can anyone comment on this?
Since the second item would be inside the room, and hence inside the isolation chamber, it would count.

Akymo
what is Humidity and how you give the guests that?
On september 8, 2011
npfan
Humidity is anything involving (mostly) water. To give a guest humidity, either place the guest next to someone that generates humidity or put a "Haywire Air-conditioning" in the guest's room.

use them in the research institute - after midnight and before they depart?
If you have any guests at 10 satisfaction, they give you a Fame point; the guests pay again, and might leave something behind. They also might destroy the room. On september 30, 2011
HuguiitoHS
WHAT IS THE INSTITUTE OF HAPPINESS FOR? HOW DO I USE IT?? PLEASE HELP!
On september 30, 2011
Vidriel
WHAT IS THE INSTITUTE OF HAPPINESS FOR? HOW DO I USE IT??

The institute is the only way to gain research points in later game when you are not getting any from tutorial quests.
To put a guest into institute, you simply send him there with click similar like when sending a guest to a bedroom. When the guest is located in a institute, he will disappear!

Each sacrificed guest gives you 20% progress in the institute. Once it makes it to 100%, you will get 1 research point, that means the price of 1 is usually 5 guests. From level 3 you can have abomination guests in your hotel and those will give you 40% progress when put into institute.

Beware, when you sacrifice a guest, this will make all other guests unhappy (also those in waiting queue!) and they will loose 1 satisfaction point. There is an upgrade Padded Cell to research which can give you nice chance that other guests will not loose any satisfaction points, but it takes some game play to gain this one

The strategy when is the guest worth to sacrifice or keep in the room to enjoy his stay and pay, is up to you what do you prefer in the game I usually sacrifice guests that I cannot satisfy well or who will make more damage to others than benefit but some people here like sacrificing guests a lot to gain more research at the start.

On november 26, 2011
Shadow09
I have a guest at 20:35. Why didn't he come?
On november 26, 2011
Erem
I have a guest at 20:35. Why didn't he come?
I'm not entirely sure what you're asking as guests only arrive on the hour*.

If what you're saying is that the clock outside your hotel said there would soon be another guest but, when it reached that time, he didn't arrive, the reason could be that you took your employee away from the desk.

The more employees you have at the reception desk, the less time you have to wait until the next guest arrives. If you take employees away from reception to carry out room service or repairs, the time until the next guest increases again.
________________________________________ ________________________________________ ___________________
*The exception to this is when you return an employee to the desk, decreasing the time till the next arrival, and you may see a guest arrive immediately.

On november 28, 2011
Shadow09
I must pay if I want tokens of apreciation ?
On november 28, 2011
Erem
I must pay if I want tokens of apreciation ?
Each time you send an employee to a guest's room, it costs a number of whether or not your employee is successful at raising the guest's satisfaction. The initial cost is 10 , but you can reduce that by 2 for each research point invested in Cheap love (down to a minimum of 4 ).

There are other things that count as tokens of appreciation that don't cost money, for example Welcome Gifts which are guaranteed to raise the guest's satidfaction by 1 point, but you can only use one per guest and it must be before they have received any other token of appreciation. If you have a Laundromatrix, Lustro-Pump, Chowrightnow or Shambrewery, you can also respond to guests' requests for room service. Each time you do, it raises the guest's satisfation by 1 point, and a guest may make more than one room service request. You do, of course, have to build the Laudromatrix etc. first, and that does cost quite a bit of !
On november 28, 2011
Erem
satidfaction --> satisfaction
satisfation --> satisfaction

It's strange how words never look misspelled on the preview!
On november 29, 2011
Kompera
I must pay if I want tokens of apreciation ?Yes. Sending an employee on the mission of raising satisfaction (which applies a token of appreciation) will always cost . You can lower the cost via the Lab option Cheap Love, lower the time needed via the Lab option Job's a good 'un, and increase your odds of successfully pleasing your guest via the Lab option Doctor Feelgood.

No matter if you choose to invest in these Lab techs or not, using dogsbodies to service your guests will cost . The Lab options simply allow you to decrease the cost, the time, and increase the chances of success.

What will happen?

On december 26, 2011
elartur
Is it possible to undo something ?
On december 26, 2011
Erem
Generally speaking, no, but what sort of thing do you want to undo?

If you've placed a guest in the wrong room, you can move them out again. (You can only move them to another bedroom or the Institute of Happiness; you can't move them back to the queue.)

If you've accidentally built a room or appliance over the top of another, you will have to build the first one again.

If you've placed the wrong equipment in a room, you can either destroy the equipment or move the guest to another room.

If you've accidentally sacrificed the wrong guest in the Institute, there's no way to bring them back.

If you don't like where you've placed a decorative object, you can move it somewhere else.

If you've painted the walls of a floor and don't like the colour, you will have to paint over it.
On december 27, 2011
Kompera
If you've assigned a dogsbody to repair a room, or to provide happiness to a guest, you can recall them before the job is done. This is only worthwhile if you've got a more urgent task for them to carry out elsewhere.

Kompera
Advice: Try to concentrate on getting to level 3 before focusing on the institute of happiness so much. There are fewer pyros and more abominations.IMO, pyros are excellent Institute fodder. Rather than blow up a room they give you 20% research. Abominations are also great for the 40% research boost, but since they don't blow up a room they are also good paying guests. I tend to spend almost all of levels 2 and 3 researching, and don't focus much on money as long as I can pay the tax. You want to get to 3/3 Padded Cell as soon as possible, because once you get a larger hotel you'll have many more guests who will get hit with the -1 Minor upset penalty for hearing you chop up other guests.

On january 26, 2012
norby89
Is it a bad idea to create two of the same facilities? I was planning on making 2 of each basic facilities ( sham, Laundry, etc )
Not at all. It really depends though on the amount of guests your hotel can accommodate and the time you have to manage your hotel. If your hotel is small you probably don't need more than 1 of each equipment but when you get 20+ guests per day and you can't look out for them 24/7 having more equipment means more satisfaction for your clients, besides when your hotel is large enough some of the rooms will never get used so it's a good idea to build more equipment.

Whoops, I got another question, are butlers bought with muxxu coins permanent? Like I can bequeath and they'll still be there?
Nope, they get reset on each bequeath.

Why is it all of a sudden 500 to expand my hotel? The other day it was just 250 and I'm not finished expanding, just need more money. I didn't go up a level or anything..
Expanding costs more and more with each room built, when you have 40+ rooms a new expansion will cost 4000+. It doesn't have to do with your level.

On january 30, 2012
ChooJeremy
Richiedude:
1.when i bequeth my hotel will i lose all of my lab stuff ?
You will lose all the lab points you have gained, yes, however you will also instantly gain lab points equal to [3*number of times you have bequeathed] (so on your first time you will get 3 points)

2.what is a prestigouus client ?
A famous client. From the help section:
VIP clients: super-whingers extraordinaire

VIPs are rare, very rare: they will appear in your queue from time to time without warning.

You can force destiny's hand by paying for advertising campaigns in your Office or by completing certain quests.

Prestigious clients can be recognised thanks to their golden halo (rich people always have a halo, it's a well known fact). They are more demanding than your average client: they start with a lower satisfaction score than regular clients and they scream the house down if they are not given a deluxe room (bedroom upgrade 1 or 2).

Note that if your hotel is level 3 or +, VIPs will demand even more luxurious bedrooms than before (bedroom upgrade 2).

dnbace:
Does that mean that if I have 25 pts, I will never have more? (I just upped to level 5 or six.. (550+ FamePoints)) I mean if I don't bequeath the hotel??
Yes. You will never get more if you don't bequeath. Think of it as a challenge of the game, that you can only get some researches and not all.

[1402592]
what is the meaning of "Night spent" in the quest? what will I do to complete that? tnx.
On february 26, 2012
Hacksaw
A "night spent" means having a guest in a room when the server clock hits midnight and collect your nightly payments from your guests.

This is in contrast to satisfying a guest (10 in some quests, 8+ in others) where their satisfaction need only be at the level at the moment they leave the hotel (at 10:00 am server time).

Hacksaw
Without appropriately spending research points Pyros will completely destroy their room every time.

Other guests only have a chance of destroying a room (be it partially, moderately or totally).

Although, any guest who checks out with low satisfaction (2 or less?) has a severely increased chance of causing total destruction.

Kompera

You start with a new hotel at level 2. You essentially reset, losing all upgrades to the hotel, lab, front desk, etc. You get 3 lab points to distribute where you like. You have a higher bar set for the next bequeath.

Kompera
Assuming nothing but upgraded rooms, there is a chart which shows expected income from guests at:
http://translate.google.com/translate?hl =en&sl=fr&u=http://www.twinpedia.com/muxxu/hotel/monstre s&ei=bRVHTsvvMsPVgQf78e2pBg&sa=X &oi=translate&ct=result&resn um=1&ved=0CB8Q7gEwAA&prev=/searc h%3Fq%3Dhttp://www.twinpedia.com/muxxu/hotel/mon stres%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26client%3D firefox-a%26hs%3DkRP%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26prmd%3Divns

For your Pyro, you should expect: 27, 33, 44 from a normal room, 1 upgrade, and 2 upgrade. The 17 difference between a normal and a max upgrade room will pay off over time. And it will pay off faster for the more lucrative guests, such as Blobs, Fish, Plants, and Bombs. I'd include Hystericals, but they don't actually pay more, it's just that with the 2 Lab points invested in them that they (can) start at a 9 Satisfaction rather than a 7, which pays more simply due to the higher Sat level rather than any intrinsic guest payout advantage.

Your money maker rooms can be anywhere, the guests will use them no matter where they are.
Is it a good idea to place special rooms in lobby (ground floor) ?Yes, because you can't build guest rooms there, so it's wasted space if you don't use it for money makers and/or service request rooms (laundromatix, etc.).

Hacksaw
Hey Quent! ^_^/")

The only difference your placement of money making rooms and services equipment makes is if you place them between two bedrooms, then that's one less side you can place another guest to boost the guests in either of those two rooms.

Personally, I put my first string of money makers in the lobby and the rest of my money makers and services on the tippy top floors, just so the rest of the floors of bedrooms can go wall to wall uninterrupted. Also for some aesthetic reasons.

On march 28, 2012
Hacksaw
What does taking care of your friends guests do? Or you taking care of theirs'?Having a guest sent by a friend allows you to boost satisfaction of other guests if your friend sends a guest with the right properties.Also, if your friend's guest (also known as a Suspicious Package leaves with a satisfaction of 10, you also get a fame point.

How to send guests to others?Add that player's name to your contact list, then visit their hotel and the option to set their likes/dislikes and what they generate (as well as an option to send a random guest) will appear in the side bar on the right of the web page.

Usually a better idea to get ahold of the person to see what they need instead of sending a random guest.
On march 28, 2012
Kompera
How to send a guest to a friend (there may be other methods which will work just as well):

Find the person in the forums;
Click on their username;
Select "Add to my contacts" (this makes them a 'friend' of yours, it does not make you their friend);
Click the "My Friends" tab;
Click the Hotel of the friend you want to send a guest to (you'll see their username under the 'Director' column);
In the right hand column you'll see Send a Guest;
Select the likes/dislikes/emanations of the guest you'd like to send to your friend (Pro tip: Always select Neighbors as a like. Pro tip: It's helpful to look at your friend's hotel and see what emanations they might need. Sending a random guest is often rather useless to your friend);
Click 'Envoyer" to send the guest.

You'll be sent back to your hotel at this point. If you'd like to see your guest, you'll need to click "My Friends" again and select your friend. You'll see your guest in the lobby of your friend unless your friend has already placed them into a room.

Kompera

Teddy Bears are of very marginal use after the initial "teach me" quests. Get used to accumulating them, I have exactly 123 of them at present. NEVER buy the Bumper Basic Pack, since the cost saving it touts is basically a free, unneeded Teddy Bear. Instead buy exactly the equipment you need.
.

Where you can use Teddy Bears after the "teach me" quests is also marginal:
They can be used to fulfill quest requirements to install equipment;
They can be used to improve the Satisfaction of Suspicious Packages, which should ALWAYS like neighbors.

Fame means nothing, so far as the game is concerned. It can be a bragging point amongst players, and there is a Hall of Fame thread which (occasionally, now that the initiator has left the game) tracks the top fame hotels. On june 7, 2012
TradeFederation

I think the question was should he 'save' the non-coin employee purchases for after the bequeath. The answer is no, because employee 2-4 always cost euros, and above always cost coins, and bequeathing only means you have to re-buy your old employees at their original costs.


The area for caution is if you are a paying player, because you have to re-buy employee 5 and 6 for coins, you need to not be bequeathing for a while when you buy them, so you have time to take advantage of them.

TradeFederation
unixasasOne gives money, another gives satisfaction.. I can't think of reason why any of them should not be built when available.

The only reason is each $ 5 room takes a room slot that could be useful for guests early on, and each one costs more than the last one, making the payback time of the last one very high. The room service rooms are pure win, as they can yield fast, large and continuous payback, especially when you get 2 and 3 day guests, which, if not pissed off with the initial placement, are almost certain to reach 10 satisfaction, if you can be online to fulfill all their service requests.

With the number of bequeaths you have done, unixasas, I doubt it will matter if you slap up all 5, but for a new player that is likely to bequeath pretty fast, there is little possibility of payback on the higher cost $ 5 rooms.

[921474]

How can i earn lab points ? and how can I build institude of happiness ?
On july 8, 2012
Plugger

You can build the Institute of Happiness when you reach Level 4 (or 3, can't remember). Click on an empty space (no washing machine, Laundr-o-Pump or bedroom) and select, 'Institute of Happiness.' Put monsters there instead of bedrooms, and you will gain lab research points for every few monsters. That big fat green guy is better in the Instite, but BEWARE! If you put a guy in there, other people might lose satisfaction (even if they don't have a room yet)!


You can also get research points by completing some missions.

Available funds 22

"Pathetic Specimen" Subsidy +278

This help is given to hotels in difficulty. Note: you can start a new hotel from scratch by going to the Office.

Remaining Funds 300 C
+

If your euro balance is below 300, you receive the difference on tax day, bringing you back up to 300. So that means you can never truly fail at this game, because however low or negative your funds get from extra repairs or whatever, you will always have more clients, and your in-game finances will auto right themselves on tax day, no matter how much you suck


Also, that subsidy description lies. Once you hit 2 stars, you can never restart in the office, like you could at lower levels

On august 26, 2012
npfan
Kompera

If you'd care to more closely define your parameters, perhaps evidence presented would be better taken, rather than being dismissed on some undisclosed criteria.


Really, lay out some clear criteria that people can compare their data points against. Or fold.

I've already pointed to a place you can look, but since apparently it wasn't explicit enough, here:
Stars | /Normal Guest
0 ...... 54.31
1 ...... 70.63
2 ...... 74.95
3 ...... 98.00
4 ...... 117.3
slope = 15.34 (>>0)
r = 0.9812
The data points are based on data collected from several players with players of the same star count grouped together, instead of one individual hotel. (Credit to TradeFederation for the raw data summary.)
Conclusion: Given a positive slope with strong linear correlation (r almost 1) based on 21 hotels, there is clear evidence that the cost per normal guest tends to increase the more one bequeaths, but that there are instances where cost per normal guest can drop with a bequeath, so there is some randomness in play, but randomness is neither the sole nor primary factor in determining advertisement costs.
It should be noted that cost per VIP guest seems to have no correlation with number of stars.
On august 26, 2012
TradeFederation

Basically, the campaign costs, number of campaigns, and usefulness of the campaigns is random, but not completely random. There is a trend, on average, of normal guests becoming more expensive as the number of bequeaths increases, which is pretty clear from the average cost of all hotels on each bequeath level, which is sad, because it almost punishes you, in a way, for getting the stars.


For example, my normal guest 2 star campaigns are better than my one star ones, in fact, I have the cheapest 2 star normal guests of ANY 2 star hotel in the list. However, even the most expensive normal guest campaign average of a 0 star hotel is 8 Croqueuros cheaper than my average, because of this general trend, which is up, even though each person has a different average cost at each level, and could buck the trend for one or two bequeaths.

unixasasWhat is a tech and what does all this paragraph mean?

Basically, research points in the laboratory. You can spend real money (20 tokens) to reset your research selections. Or you could just bequeath and get the same thing, except you would have new campaigns, and would have to re-earn your research points before re-spending them.
On september 6, 2012
Tollers

Quick question:

Does it matter when you place your guests during the day? Will they have the same number of room service requests if you just place them in their room late in the day?
On september 6, 2012
TradeFederation

It matters. Its possible to have zero, one, or two room service requests a day, and you are more likely to not have a request on a late placed guest, and more likely to have two requests from an early placed guest, or a multi-day guest on the second or third day. Also, room service requests after in-game midnight mean less money, because it happened after one of the guest's payments, and the passive effect rooms have more chances to earn money, if the guests are in the hotel earlier (if you have any of those rooms) On the plus side, you are more likely to have the effects all your guests want, and it is easier to place the guests, once they have all arrived and you know what you have to work with.

On september 28, 2012
TradeFederation
TollersFirework display, i cant remember the effects. whats the overall +satisfaction?

It depends on a few variables.


+6 satisfaction for the guest, with 3 levels of damage to the room.


A normal guest will get -3 satisfaction from 3 levels of damage, neting you +3 satisfaction overall, you can get +5 net satisfaction if you move the guest out, repair, and move them back in, if they had not been moved before. +6 net satisfaction, if you use a repair kit on the room.


A VIP guest wll get -6 satisfaction from 3 levels of damage, -2 per level, which means fireworks have no net effect on VIP's, unless you can repair the room


Fireworks also destroy any other item also in the room, if there is one, so you could actually get negative net satisfaction, if the firework destroys an effect item that was meeting a desire of that guest

How do Random Wallpaper and Surprise lower-wall change the walls?
On october 1, 2012
TradeFederation

Wallpaper changes the color of the floor in a random way. The surprise lower wall puts a 'tilt' on the floor of that level, making it look crooked.


I have learned the tech 'Crystal ball' this bequeath, even though it completely sucks, just to test the exact timing and number and effects of the different types of room service requests, so I should have an exact description of how they work in a few months.


From the first 20 or so guests, i can say that the first room service request hits between 1 and 9 hours from the time the guest is placed in a room for the first time, it increments in units of exactly 1 hour, and never pops later than 4 AM on checkout day. This means that a guest placed by 19:00 or earlier will always make at least one room service request, and any placed later than that have a lesser chance to make a request the later in the day they are placed in a room. When i level up and start getting multi-day guests, ill test the time for second room service requests. It must be longer than 9 hours, or early placed guests would always have 2 or more requests per day, which they do not.

TradeFederation
Tollers

The Lab skill: "In your Sky"

Whats the savings on this? worth getting ?

Savings is 15% with all 3 levels. Its pretty meh, and I usually avoid the tax with poverty. The only useful thing about this is if you save up as much cash as you can before bequeathing, while paying the tax every week. I did this last bequeath, and It seems like a good idea, because you can rebuild most of your hotel right away. (I was able to stockpile 70,000 CE in 6 weeks of pure saving and leveling, which will also get you 700 fame stars from all the tax paying)


Assuming you eventually pay the tax to level 10, you save a total of 5060 CE at level 3 In Your Sky. I have estimated that you would have to put 250 pyros in your hotel before Mastery : Pyromaniac would save more on repairs, And I am certain i did not place that many pyros before bequeathing. (about 1700 total guests since starting the game)


Do not take In Your Sky over any other tech, unless you will actually pay the tax to level 10 before bequeathing. There is no gameplay reason to ever level over 7, and I would argue that level 4 or 5 is probably as high as you want to go while building up your hotel, both to have more weeks to save up for the bequeath, and because the level 6 and 7 new guests and builds are not that good overall.

XorkasI expanded my ground floor but i only got more lobby, cant build anything there?

It looks like you are new to the game. As you gain levels, you will be able to build Room Service rooms, Effect rooms and Institute of Happynesses in that area, but not guest rooms.

I just have a desk and a door, and let em queue up outside, like a new consumer product release

Guests sents by friend spent money in the Special Buildings (Astro Gastro, Waste Disposal, etc..)?
On november 17, 2012
TradeFederation
HammerFallGuests sents by friend spent money in the Special Buildings (Astro Gastro, Waste Disposal, etc..)?

Yes, friend guests do everything normal guests do, except pay at midnight and checkout. They can use special buildings, be sacrificed to the institute, leave objects behind, make room service requests, and even have all the random events happen to them.


Also, the Special buildings are usually not worth building until your hotel is SOOOO big that you have lots of empty rooms even after using your campaigns. I can see that your hotel is completely full, and you still have a guest waiting. You would make lots more money with more full guest rooms, rather than your full set of special buildings. A room with a one day normal guest at satisfaction 7 will pay 27 midnight +27 checkout = 54 each day, while a special room can theoretically only make a max of 50 each day, assuming it were continuously used all day, which would require at least 3 guests that liked that effect for each special room, and with a current max of 8 guests, that will never happen for you. With high-payout guests and upgraded rooms, its not uncommon for me to have a single guest that pays out 200 or more each day

On december 3, 2012
TradeFederation
isurvivenowq 1 : can i prevent sink caughing fire? q 2 : is it good to build watse disposal, disco ,astro gastro etc etc ?

Q 1 : Yes, If you do not build any guest rooms, you will not have any sink fires. Although you will also not be able to progress in the game, either


Q 1 (more seriously) : If you have more rooms than you have guests, then you have better odds of an empty room getting 'sinked' True story, when my hotel had 30 rooms, I had 29 guests, and that last empty room was the one to go up in flames that day. So you can improve your odds of sidestepping upset guests by having lots of extra guest rooms. You can also move guests out and use your employees to fix the room and then move the guest back, as long as it is not after midnight on the guest's last day.


You should also repair any empty room that is damaged by putting an employee in it before putting a new guest there. You can do this even if you do not have any to pay for the repairs



Q 2 : No, they are not worth building, especially in a small hotel, like yours. They only work if you have a guest staying in your hotel that likes the effect that the room offers. For example, of your four guests, only one likes smells that your Waste Disposal room offers, and will only use it every 6 hours at most, so you will at the most make 15 per day from the Waste Disposal, while an occupied basic room with a 7 satisfaction guest will pay 27 at midnight, and 27 at checkout.


The better move for you now is to build more basic rooms, and hire more employees in the supermarket tab, and put them at your desk to bring in more guests during the game day before midnight, to fill up your hotel with more paying customers.


Once you have lots more rooms than you have guests, and you have lots of guests, the effect rooms become a better value, but until you have more than 30 rooms, you can usually fill all the space with paying customers, with 4 employees and your advertising campaigns.

how do i get i gift client and give a gift client?
On december 22, 2012
TradeFederation
Whitenesshow do i get i gift client and give a gift client?

To get one, just go to the Guest Exchange - Part 2 thread, and request one with the likes and effect you need. To send one, just add the player you want to send to as a contact, then look at their Monster Motel profile or click on their motel in your friends list, and a Send Guest button will appear and you can send them what they need. You can only send 1 guest per day, but you could receive many, if people are willing to send them to you.

On january 9, 2013
TradeFederation

Advertising campaigns are set for each bequeath (star level of your hotel) You can buy each one each day, and you can buy them all if you want, and they all reset at 6 AM, when your paid-for guests arrive, and they never change in cost or number or type of guests, until your next bequeath.If you have space in your hotel, they are usually a good buy, as more guests gives you more chances of getting all the effects you need. Having all your rooms upgraded to level 3 also makes the campaigns more worthwhile, because all of your payouts will be bigger per guest. More guests also increases your chances of getting random VIP's. I have received several random VIP guests from normal campaigns over time.

On january 27, 2013
burlington

What's the best way to manage Institute of Happiness?
On january 27, 2013
TradeFederation
burlingtonWhat's the best way to manage Institute of Happiness?

Its a matter of opinion. You could sacrifice a few hard to place guests every so often, but this usually leads to lots of other pissed off guests and little if any payments at checkout on those days.


My personal strategy is to build two institutes and send every single guest to them right when i start a new hotel (bequeath), until I have all the lab points I can use for my star level. Then I replace the institutes with other types of rooms, because the institutes don't make money directly on a day to day basis, only through the payment boosting techs you unlock with with the institute lab points.


Guests can be sacrificed right up to their 10 AM (game time) checkout, even if they cannot be moved from room to room anymore. So if you run out of time to get everyone 'processed' in the institute before midnight, you can place them in the hotel rooms before midnight to prevent them from leaving, then make sure they are all sacrificed before the 10 AM checkout. Guests at 0 satisfaction always destroy the room at checkout, like Pyro's, so its best that no guests that pissed live long enough to check out.


It takes a fair number of real world days to get enough sacrifice guests to earn all the lab points, and you need a lot of additional guests to really make the techs pay off, so if you are close to bequeathing your hotel, you might be better off just earning as much cash as fast as possible, and saving the institute sacrifices for your next hotel.


There is a 'special' guest type (Hysterical) that will upset every other guest in your hotel if she is not happy (-3 satisfaction to EVERY other guest). In the event that you piss of a Hysterical guest, and cannot get her satisfaction up, putting her in an institute can be the best way to solve the problem, even with the minor upsets that can cause.

On february 10, 2013
TradeFederation

There is a lull doing this, no denying it, but its only about 10 days. There are things that can speed it up, such as bequeathing on a Saturday, which gets you extra starting money (you dodge the last tax assessment), and levels you to 3 immediately on Sunday, getting you abominations every 5 guests, on average (double research value). You also start with a fairly good number of research points ready to spend (more each level, it seems), and you can buy moar guests with your campaigns as well. You are still 'playing' this game about the same, even more, actually, than with a full hotel, because you have to log in every 2 hours to keep the killing spree going, instead of the usual room service requests you would normally do.



Killing them slowly has its disadvantages as well. You get much less money per (potentially high paying) guest without the mastery techs, and its super hard to give tokens of appreciation successfully, and at 10 each, you lose money on each one given, successful or not. You also lose about 10-15% of the day's money, if the hotel is half full, each sacrifice, because of the minor upsets take away the most valuable high satisfaction levels. IMO, Its just better to avoid any upset guests and have the techs right away, so you get more time with use of the tech upgrades.

On february 11, 2013
TradeFederation

There is no built-in leaderboard for this game. The hall of fame is maintained by the players themselves, so its always out of date and missing some people that don't post but still have tons of stars.



You can see the stats of all of your friends in the game, ordered by fame stars and updated by the system, but you have to manually add everyone you want to track. Since this game has not been updated for at least as long as I have played it, its very unlikely you could ever really know where you rank, unless you break into the top 15, and those levels are constantly increasing, so you will really need to get lucky on your campaigns to have a chance.

On february 18, 2013
TradeFederation
EdgyVenison

If we install an isolation chamber at a guest's room, and then we sacrifice one other guest to the institute of happiness, will the guest with the isolation chamber get the minor upset penalty?

At level 3 of Armour Upgrade research, how much is the odds reducement for rooms to break?
At level 3 or Padded Cell research, how much is the odds of the penalty ignorance?
At level 3 of Mad Architect research, how much is the hotel expansion discount?
At level 3 of Doctor Feelgood research, how much is the odds bonus of the tokens of appreciation odds of success?

Q1 : For the isolation chamber, the only way to know is to test it, and I have not tried it yet. I'll set one up.


Q2 : Armor Upgrade Level 3
Based on 1200 guests, the odds of a happy guest (not 0 satisfaction) doing one level of damage to the room, at armor level 3, is 31.984 %


I have not tested the no armor damage rate (yet ), but i would estimate it at 75 - 80 %, so the odds reduction rate is about 2/3 less likely to happen.


IMO, armor tech is a low priority tech, especially for a small hotel, because the cost and time of these tiny repairs is low, relative to the value of other techs, including the income boost from the mastery techs and the savings from the other repair techs and item increasing techs. However, once you have more than 50 rooms, the 2 minutes spent per damaged room really starts to add up, and this will save you a lot of play time doing minor repairs, so its usefulness increases with the number of occupied rooms.


Q3 : Padded Cell
My personal playstyle is to just sacrifice everyone until i have all the techs i can, so this is a tech I do not normally use, however, since I got all six employees for my current hotel, and you can only have 2 institutes at most , I cannot kill all my natural guests, even if i were online all day, so I have started testing this. Based on half a day of testing (not very much, yet), the level 3 padded cell gives each guest a 34.9 % chance of getting upset per sacrifice, versus a 100 % chance with no padded cell tech. So, it works, and it works more than half the time, but some guests are gonna get upset, even at level 3.


IMO, this is a low priority tech, because you can (usually) kill everyone with two institutes and bypass the whole issue. However, if your playstyle is to kill a few guests slowly while you have lots of real guests in your hotel, this will avoid most of the upsets, once you get it to level 3.


Q4 : Mad Architect
This is exact, Level 1, 94 %, Level 2, 87 %, Level 3, 80 % of the full price per addition. This is an excellent tech, but it only really pays off once you are a 2 star hotel or higher. At one star, you only save about 900 total to build all 20 rooms you need, so you would actually be better off with other techs that pay off faster.


Q5 : Doctor Feelgood
I have not tested this, but if you want to give the tokens at all, this tech is a must have, fully leveled, to make it worthwhile. My guess is the normal failure rate of tokens of appreciation is around 70 %, and with feelgood it goes down to about 30 %


IMO, if you are giving tokens to anyone but VIP's, you should have 3 points in feelgood and 3 points in cheap love, otherwise the cost is just too high (10 without cheap love) to ever pay back the cost at checkout, because of the odds of failure. If you add Jobs a good un at level 3, you can hand out tons of tokens every day (a set every 2 hours), if you have the real world time to devote to this game, and I have been able to get 20+ guests all to 10 satisfaction, using these 3 techs together, and they can pay off pretty good in and 's

On february 20, 2013
TradeFederation

On my 0 star hotel, i did 3 in DIY guys and 1 in Nomadic Pleasure. I did not do any other tech, because I did not need to. I bequeathed almost immediately, even before finishing the tutorial, because you only need 14 rooms for the first bequeath, including the desk and any extra rooms in the lobby. I never used any of my super low cost campaigns, not even once, because once i reached level 4, I could easily fill my 11 usable rooms (1 for the desk, and 2 room service rooms) with just normal 4 employee guests, because some guests are 2 and 3 day guests at that level.


The only way to use those low cost campaigns is to build a LOT more guest rooms than you need to for 0 star. I actually never used more than 2 campaigns at once, until i was 3 star, and had the required 50 rooms for that star level (41 guest rooms)


Assuming you choose to spend several monthis at 0 star and build 30+ rooms you are not required to build, here's what i would suggest.


3 points DIY guys (repairs are always needed, this makes them all cheaper)


1 point Nomadic Pleasure (lets you move guests for half penalty)


3 points Mad Architect (only if you build lots of extra rooms)


1 point Dr Feelgood (you have to put 8 points in to unlock the third tier, this point could go into crystal ball or armor plating, if you wanted to)


2 points Blobs
2 Points Bombs
2 points Fish
2 points Hysterical
2 points Plants


This tier is where you make all your money, these techs double the payments of 4 of your 12 guest types. In addition, the extra payment is affected by upgraded rooms, diamond beds, and multi-day guests, so you can potentially make up to 800 off a single guest, if you get really lucky.


The 2 points in Hysterical is for protection of your hotel. The hotel wide effect of even one single Hysterical at 4 satisfaction could possibly explode all of your bomb guests(they explode at 0 satisfaction), cost you a whole day's pay, and trash every room, if you cannot calm them. It also makes them easier to get the max payout from.


1 point toughened equipment (I like my equipment )


3 points Racket (extra free stuff every night left by guests at checkout, did i mention these items are FREE, the same stuff you could pay real money for in the supermarket section )


3 points In your sky ( The tax always gets bigger when you pay it, the less you pay, the more you keep. If you are hoarding cash, this is your tech.)



Other strategies :


Upgrade all rooms to level 3, it makes all guest payments 60% higher, increases your margins for campaigns a lot.


Hold your 3 points for the In your sky tech in your lab pool, dont buy this right away. You want to stay level 4 for the whole time you are building your rooms and upgrading them. You stay that level by intentionally being broke on tax day (not buying any campaigns the day before, not fully satisfying every guest, spending down all your free cash before midnight). Not having that tech means you can hold more cash without triggering the tax on tax day, until you are fully built out, then you upgrade the tech, pay the tax every week, and hoard as much cash as you can.


Level 4 is ideal, because you get 3 day guests at that level, and many good guest types. You also want as many weeks of low taxes as you can have, so you don't want to level up more than you have to, until you are done building and upgrading.

On may 13, 2013
TradeFederation

Basically, most of this game is random. Your campaigns are what they are because of random chance, and its highly unlikely to get any two with the same cost per guest. If you are not buying all the campaigns, you should always buy the lower cost ones first, there is no benefit to paying more per normal guest, unless you buy several of the campaigns at once.


The advantage to the more expensive campaigns is you can bring in more total guests. There is no limit to the number of campaigns you can buy in one day, and they all come back the next day. If you have the , a large enough hotel, and the right techs, you can usually profit from all of the campaigns, whatever the price. More guests means more guest effects, more likely to have all the effects, more items left behind at checkout, more multi-day guests, more visitors to your effects rooms, and, like unixasas said, more chances at special guest types, like VIPs, but also the high-paying guest types, or guests with desirable effects.


Also, since the guests are completely random, there is a gambling-like element to the campaigns, as you can get a big payoff if you get lucky on your extra guests

On may 15, 2013
TradeFederation
SpongeBlockThe game says that I have -1 ! Is this normal?

This game is a bit on the easy side. If you run out of money, you can still perform repairs, as much as you need to, and just go into debt for a while. This prevents you from getting into an unrecoverable situation, as certain guest types and events can damage most of your rooms at once, and if you could not afford to repair them, you might not be able to make any money going foward, because guests placed in damaged rooms get upset.


Its possible to game this deficit spending to your advantage. If you spend all your money on the day the tax is due, sacrifice all your guests to the institute, then go into debt repairing rooms, the tax man will actually give you a 'pathetic specimen' subsidy and bring you back to 250 I was only able to do this once, so it may be limited to lower level hotels, but it does work, and can provide a nice boost to a low level hotel.

On may 16, 2013
TradeFederation
BitrixaSounds like a plan I could use. I just have a question: if I sacrifice all my guests before their departure, how could I possibly repair rooms that have not been damaged at all because there were no guests in them to damage them in the first place?

Its a little tricky, but if you have normal guests in rooms on tax day, you will earn enough normal income that you won't get the free money. So you get your rooms damaged a previous day at checkout, spend all your money on other things, repair the rooms, then, instead of filling your hotel normally, you sacrifice everyone to your institute, so you do not have any guests in your hotel at midnight, when taxes are due.


It takes some planning, but you have to sacrifice guests anyway if you want tech, so you might as well do it on a day that can get you some bonus money.


BitrixaOn another topic, I also wanted to consult this: is it just a silly idea of mine, or is it better to let guests accumulate all day (they won't leave until midnight after all) so you can place them all at the same time in the best way instead of just placing them one by one as they come? Only problem I see with this is that they won't have time to require laundry etc. so those extra points will be lost - but random sinks burning and other negative points will be lost too, which it isn't all bad. What do you guys think?

Many players just let the guests pile up till before midnight to see all the effects they have, and place them then. One thing to remember is that unplaced guests are like Cinderella's Fairy Godmother's magic, they all wink at the stroke of midnight, so if something comes up and you log back in at 00:05, you will have a very empty hotel that day. Also, the game can freeze up close to 00:00, so you can't place guests up to the last instant.


First room service requests are always made in the first 12 hours after placing a guest, up until 4:00 gametime. Every guest placed before 15:59 will ALWAYS make a room service request, if you are at least level 2. Every hour closer to 24:00 you get, there is a 1 in 12 less chance of getting a room service request, so if you place your guests between 23:00 and 23:59, you will have only a 1 in 3 chance of a room service request for each guest.


There are good events as well as bad ones, but there seem to be more bad events, and the bad ones tend to be worse than the good ones. If you have multi-day guests still in your hotel from the last day, you are still exposed to the negative events. Also, sinks and missiles can hit empty hotels, but the damage is limited to repair costs if there are no guests to upset. Also, events are fairly rare, so you shouldn't let them dominate your planning.

On june 14, 2013
TradeFederation
mitheI know.
My question was, why usually a guest with 8 satisfaction pays 56 and that what I have pays only 35 also with satisfaction 8...

I don't know how, but now it show it correctly.

It is the 'level' of the room the guest is in. Level 1 room pays 35 at 8 satisfaction with a normal guest.


A level 3 room pays 160% of a level 1 room, so 35 * 1.6 = 56 Which is the reason it often pays to upgrade all your rooms, so all that bonus cash rolls in from every guest every day.

This part is correct.

MindrielAnd what other limits are there? I think you cannot build completely around an empty block?

Once you build a new row, you cannot build up to the same row. In other words, once there's a room in a row, additional rooms in that row can only be build from the sides.

On july 20, 2013
GrotteDesHeros
Ernshow many upgrade on the reception to accomodate 6 dogsbodies ? Is it possible to have more than 6 dogsbodies ?

The first welcome desk upgrade costs 250 , with the third employee costing 500 , adding up to 750 . After that, the next desk upgrade costs 500 and the employee 1000 , adding up to 1500 .
The desk upgrade after that costs 1500 , and the employee 45 , meaing it is impossible to buy unless you pay real money or you get an MTPass from CaraPass. (1 MTPass = 100 )
The final desk upgrade costs 2000 , and the employee 60 .

You can pay even more for more employees, but they cannot be placed at the welcome desk. You can only use them for tokens of appreciation, or repairing rooms.

unixasas30 minutes: http://clip2net.com/s/5AAlrp

This is how long it takes for the equipment to run through it's cycle and become available again, not how long he has to fulfill the request before the guest cancels it. Edit: Unless I misread his question and he really was wondering how long before the equipment becomes available agian.

On august 19, 2013
unixasas

So, the time needed to do laundry or shine the shoes is the time needed for an equipment to run through its cycle the picture illustrates that one could see the exact time at which the equipment is available, thus will have given the shoes / etc. back to the guest.
On august 19, 2013
ChooJeremy

TradeFederationThe requests last 6 hours, and the sooner you meet the request, the sooner the next request will be made, if there is enough time for a next request. If you do not meet a request, it disappears, and the timer restarts on the next request. The timer for the next request is different if you meet a request or miss a request.
Learn more: http://twd.io/e/AXHL/21

The thread is overall a wonderful thread filled with detailed information by the way, if you're really interested in this game I strongly recommend reading it one day.

Basically, all guests will make a request at some random point of time, and for all requests, you have 6 hours to fulfill them.

[8039106]

hey guys, i was just wondering if the fireworks display item is worth using and if anyone knows how much satisfaction it gives the customer
the description says it increases earnings a LOT the first night, but then destroys the room so hard that we have to repaint it??

On april 2, 2014
unixasas

It gives +6 in total, but -3 are taken immediately due to destroyed room. Works perfectly on VIP guests that are leaving tomorrow, hate everything and are impossible to get +10 satisfaction from request(s), matelala and zombies.
I also use them on fishes that leave in 3 days and also hates everything, next day I repair and sometimes even add a diamond.
Room needs to be repaired, not repainted. The only time my rooms lost paint was when a jet plane crashed into the 12th floor.
On april 6, 2014
TradeFederation

To be more specific, Fireworks give +6 tokens at in game midnight, and do 3 points of damage to a room. They do NOT work perfectly for VIP, because VIP get -2 per damage point, so it won't help a VIP at all (+6 fireworks, -6 room damage), unless you can repair the room, either with a kit, or by moving the guest. The best use of fireworks is Dumb Fish with 2 dislikes, because they pay double with their tech, and you cannot use your employees to give them tokens, because of their special negative trait. Anyone staying more than one day can be moved and the room repaired, which will almost always get them way over 10 satisfaction. Fireworks also destroy any other object installed in the room, so they are not useful if there is an effect object being used by the guest, cause they will lose the bonus that item was giving

does bequeathing our hotel let us build a new hotel from scratch?

On may 6, 2014
unixasas

You will keep:All un-used objects (except decorative objects, whether installed or not)Unused decorations are kept, but I don't have extra paint and cannot confirm. Installed probably means used but kept in inventory and used during Change the furnishings mode.
On may 6, 2014
sebis7
goatdoes bequeathing our hotel let us build a new hotel from scratch?
do we get to keep our pots of paint in that case?

You will keep your as well as everything that's listed under the three tabs

- "decorate" (blue) (including buckets of paint )
- "special" (light blue)
- "store" (green)

Everything else is lost.

Hint:
I recommend making with your old hotel until Sunday, then bequeath and start a new hotel just before midnight. This way you will level up your new hotel on your first day.

Another hint:
I recommend finishing the complete set of starter missions, as these missions can give you paint / wallpaper / etc. as rewards. Once you finished them, you will get repeating standard missions that only give 5 fame points as a reward. After bequeathing, you will automatically switch to standard missions and you will never get any paint or wallpaper unless you pay for them with muxxu tokens.

On may 12, 2014

On may 12, 2014
valer
blue4029how much satisfaction does a client need for them to start liking the hotel?

Satisfaction levels:
0: The client leaves furious and may wreck the room as a result. If you leave a Bomb at this level for too long, they will explode. Window light: red.
1-4: The client is dissatisfied. A Hysterical Type will scream and cause -3 satisfaction to others. Window light: red.
5: The client is dissatisfied. Window light: red.
6-8: The client is satisfied and counts as well-treated in your statistics. Window light: orange.
9: Same as for 6-8, but the window color is yellow.
10: The client leaves ecstatic and you get a fame point (or more for VIPs). If you leave a Bomb at this level for too long, they will explode.


Satisfaction also corresponds to the negative, positive and neutral flavour text in the thought bubbles.

Click on your desk employee and he'll pop up to the top left corner. Then you click on him to select him and then drop him in the room. He'll fix it for a while and then go back to the top left corner where you'll want to click on him again and put him back on the desk.

On june 30, 2014
Chime

What's the average radius of a guests personal "aura"? There are quests the produce heat or smell and such and that affects the room next door. Do they affect the rooms above and beneath them as well?
On june 30, 2014
unixasas

Yes. The radius is 1 room to the left, right, up and down. Not diagonally.
On july 14, 2014
[8039106]

does bequeathing hotel reset the fame level to 0? also, is there a way to switch off the automatic consortium tax deduction that levels up the hotel? because every time i try to save up 3000 to bequeath hotel, the consortium tax (1500, 2000 ) takes all my money away making it impossible to get 3000

On july 14, 2014
unixasas

No, the points are accumulated continually.
There is no way to switch off the payment, but you can plan your income and expenses to not have enough for the payment, if you wish to skip one (don't place guests, don't raise their satisfaction, but campaigns, build new rooms or new rooms over the old ones).

On july 15, 2014
Tetsab
gotzethe consortium tax (1500, 2000 ) takes all my money away making it impossible to get 3000

The trick here is to get money at a much faster rate and bequeath just before the tax comes in. This post to start and then the one linked directly above it outline just how to do that (the linked one in amazing detail!).

Edit: And bequeathing doesn't lose your current fame, it gains you more.
